metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20225 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. The option parserallows an attacker to write past the end of a heap-allocated buffer bycalling certain commands with a large number of specific short forms ofoptions. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu42
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.164
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.164
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2-unsigned package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu42').
grub2-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.164').
grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
